verses.text: Praise becomes you, O God, in Sion; and to you shall the vow be performed.
Hear my prayer; to you all flesh shall come.
The words of transgressors have overpowered us; but do you pardon our sins.
Blessed \add is he\add* whom you have chosen and adopted; he shall dwell in your courts; we shall be filled with the good things of your house; your temple is holy.
\add You are\add* wonderful in righteousness. Listen to us, O God our Saviour; the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them \add that are\add* on the sea afar off:
who do \f + \fr 64:6 \fl Gr. \ft prepare. \f* establish the mountains in your strength, being girded about with power;
who trouble the depth of the sea, the sounds of its waves.
The nations shall be troubled, and they that inhabit the ends \add of the earth\add* shall be afraid of your signs; you will cause the outgoings of morning and evening to rejoice.
You have visited the earth, and saturated it; you have abundantly enriched it. The river of God is filled with water; you have prepared their food, for thus is the preparation \add of it\add*.
Saturate her furrows, multiply her fruits; \add the crop\add* springing up shall rejoice in its drops.
You will bless the crown of the year \add because\add* of your goodness; and your plains shall be filled with fatness.
The mountains of the wilderness shall be enriched; and the hills shall gird themselves with joy.
The rams of the flock are clothed \add with wool\add*, and the valleys shall abound in corn; they shall cry aloud, yes they shall sing hymns.
